We hope you find the “A day in the life” video and our Wellsville Secondary School Starter Packet helpful. Secondary School Class of 2020 Senior Scholarship Night.

We are pleased to announce that the 2020 Senior Scholarship Night “Virtual” Program will be on Tuesday, June 23rd at 6:30 p.m. The ceremony will be accessible on the Wellsville Central School’s YouTube channel. If you do not subscribe to our YouTube channel, an easy access link will be posted on the Wellsville Secondary School’s Webpage www.wellsvilleschools.org at the same time.

Our program continues to award our Seniors up to $100.000 in local scholarship donations from area businesses, organizations, foundations, individuals and alumni groups. The success of our annual scholarship program is a direct result of our donors and we thank you for your support.

We look forward to celebrating the accomplishments of the Class of 2020.

News Provided By
Wellsville Central School District
June 3, 2020, 8:30 am

Erica Aftuck was appointed Athletic Director for Wellsville Schools at last evening’s Board of Education meeting. Erica has been a teacher at Wellsville since 2011. She has been the Girls Varsity Soccer head coach for six years and the Junior & Senior Class Advisor for four years, as well as the student council advisor for five years. Erica has taught Health and Physical Education at the secondary school since her arrival. We welcome Erica and are proud of her achievements. She is a strong advocate for students and we wish her much success. Erica takes the position following the retirement of Wellsville Administrator, Dean Giopulos. Erica will move into the position effective July 1, 2020. Congratulations to Erica. Go Lions!

David Foster
Superintendent

post_text: You are invited to attend an important informational night we will be hosting led by Mercedes Lasher, ACCORD Corp. Domestic Violence Community Educator, for parents and other caring adults in the Wellsville Secondary School on Monday, 2/24 from 6:00-7:00 p.m. called One Love. One Love is a program that was developed by the family of University of Virginia senior, Yeardley Love. Tragically, Yeardley died at the hands of her boyfriend three weeks before graduation from college. One Love is a national leader in preventing relationship violence and abuse by teaching young people and adults about healthy relationships and the warning signs of unhealthy behaviors that strain relationships and can lead to abuse. One Love addresses all relationships, including friendships, to help bring a better understanding of what love is and what it isn’t. We are excited to join the conversation to empower people to identify and avoid abuse from relationship violence. We would love it if you would join us and spread the word! Please see the below flyer for more details and the One Love links.

post_text: Last evening the Board of Education unanimously approved a resolution to move to a Latin Honors means of recognizing student academic achievement at graduation. The Latin Honors system will begin with the graduating class of 2025. Students achieving at the highest level will be recognized as graduating Summa Cum Laude for a cumulative high school average at or above 96%, Magna Cum Laude for an average at or above 92%, and Cum Laude for an average at or above 88%. The average levels assure a rigorous measure of academic achievement. We would eliminate the publication of class rank unless requested by a college or university. The High School will establish a process to determine honors speaker(s) at graduation. I want to thank the many committee members who researched and met throughout 2018-2019 and who presented their recommendation to the Board. Later today, we will post the process and rationale for the change on the school website at www.wellsvilleschools.org.
